intro: Maytenus racemosa, commonly known as the clustered mayten, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. Maytenus racemosa is often found in dry forests and scrublands, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
